moves.4. f4: I do this quite often, bring my pieces to center then sacrifice f pawn, to open it for my rook after castling. In past I had good results with it, also want to hear your opinions about it...but now I was kinda playing bindly and did moves uncarefully
moves.5. Nf3: the other option was bringing back my bishop to e2, which maybe wasa better move, but I wanted to develop while defending
moves.5... exf4 6. d3: still not really aware of tactical potential of black pieces
moves.6... Nh5 7. h3: I'm really annoyed by this bishop
moves.11. Kd2 Qf2+ 12. Qxf2 Nxf2 13. Rf1 Nxe4+: so...so far I'm one whole piece down, but have some active pieces. which I need to convert to winning advantage.the black king is in the centre and has weak defence
moves.16. Bxf7+: check, besides winning a pawn, more importnantly this move makes sure that black king will stay in the centre which is crucial...
moves.17... Bxg5 18. Bxg5+ Ke8: I can take b7, but I have better option
moves.19... Kd7 20. Re7+: one more check, my rook will make some real trouble to 7th rank
moves.23. Re7+ Kd8 24. Rxb7+ Kc8 25. Rxh7 Nc6: giving free night is of course better than whole free rook
moves.26. Bxc6 Rb8 27. b3: not allowing any attacking chances to my opponent
moves.27... Rg8: this is mistake, which allows me to do little tactical operation
moves.28... Kc7 29. Be6+: check again, now black can't save g rook. here black resigned.
